meta.title: Agentic SDLC
meta.subtitle: AI-Powered Software Development
meta.description: How AI agents are transforming every phase of the software development lifecycle.
meta.author: Engineering Team

slides.title: Agentic SDLC
slides.subtitle: Introduction
slides.content: The future of software development is autonomous, intelligent, and collaborative.
slides.visualContent:
graph TD
    A[Human Intent] --> B[AI Agent]
    B --> C[Plan]
    B --> D[Code]
    B --> E[Test]
    B --> F[Deploy]
    C --> G[Working Software]
    D --> G
    E --> G
    F --> G

slides.title: What We'll Cover
slides.subtitle: Agenda
slides.content: A comprehensive look at AI-powered software development in 2025.

items.title: 1. The Shift
items.text: From traditional to agentic development

items.title: 2. The Phases
items.text: AI across the entire SDLC

items.title: 3. The Tools
items.text: Modern agentic platforms & MCP

items.title: 4. Security & Risks
items.text: Navigating the challenges

items.title: 5. The Practice
items.text: Best practices and adoption

items.title: 6. The Future
items.text: Where we're heading

slides.title: The 2025 Reality
slides.subtitle: The Shift
slides.content: AI in software development has reached mainstream adoption.

items.text: Expect AI role in development to grow significantly (up from 70.5% in 2024)
Companies using AI in development for over a year (up from 32.5%)
Speed gain: Feature rollout from 3 weeks to 8 days
Enterprise apps expected to use agentic AI by 2028 (from <1% in 2024)

slides.title: The Traditional SDLC
slides.subtitle: The Shift
slides.content: The classic waterfall and agile approaches we've used for decades.
slides.visualContent:
graph LR
    A[Requirements] --> B[Design]
    B --> C[Development]
    C --> D[Testing]
    D --> E[Deployment]
    E --> F[Maintenance]
    F -.-> A

slides.title: The Problem with Traditional SDLC
slides.subtitle: The Shift
slides.content: Manual processes create bottlenecks and slow delivery.

items.title: Context Switching
items.text: Developers lose hours switching between tasks and tools

items.title: Knowledge Silos
items.text: Critical information trapped in individuals

items.title: Repetitive Work
items.text: 60-80% of coding tasks are repetitive (2025 projection)

items.title: Slow Feedback
items.text: Bugs discovered late in the cycle are expensive to fix

slides.title: Three Levels of AI Development
slides.subtitle: The Shift
slides.content: Understanding the spectrum from assistance to autonomy.
slides.visualContent:
graph TD
    subgraph Level 1
        A[AI-Assisted]
        A1[Autocomplete & Suggestions]
    end
    subgraph Level 2
        B[AI-Collaborative]
        B1[Workflow Automation]
    end
    subgraph Level 3
        C[Fully Agentic]
        C1[Autonomous Execution]
    end
    A --> B
    B --> C

slides.title: Enter Agentic SDLC
slides.subtitle: The Shift
slides.content: AI agents as collaborative partners throughout development.
slides.visualContent:
graph TD
    subgraph Human
        A[Intent & Direction]
        B[Review & Approve]
    end
    subgraph Agent
        C[Understand Context]
        D[Generate Solutions]
        E[Execute & Iterate]
        F[Learn & Improve]
    end
    A --> C
    C --> D
    D --> E
    E --> B
    B --> F
    F --> C

slides.title: Human-on-the-Loop
slides.subtitle: The Shift
slides.content: The new AI control model that actually works.

items.title: Human-in-the-Loop
items.text: Approve every action (slow, safe)

items.title: Human-on-the-Loop
items.text: Monitor and intervene when needed (balanced)

items.title: Human-out-of-Loop
items.text: Full autonomy (fast, risky)

slides.title: Productivity Impact
slides.subtitle: The Shift
slides.content: Real-world productivity gains measured in 2025 studies.

slides.title: The DORA Warning
slides.subtitle: The Shift
slides.content: AI adoption requires safeguards for stability.

items.title: Productivity Up 2%
items.text: Individual developer productivity increased with AI

items.title: Stability Down 7%
items.text: Without safeguards like small batch sizes and testing

items.title: The Lesson
items.text: AI must be paired with systemic safeguards to succeed

slides.title: Requirements & Planning
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: AI transforms how we gather and refine requirements.
slides.visualContent:
graph LR
    A[User Story] --> B[AI Analysis]
    B --> C[Clarifying Questions]
    C --> D[Refined Requirements]
    D --> E[Acceptance Criteria]
    D --> F[Test Cases]
    D --> G[Task Breakdown]

slides.title: AI-Powered Requirements
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: From vague ideas to actionable specifications.

items.title: Natural Language Input
items.text: Describe what you want in plain English

items.title: Ambiguity Detection
items.text: AI identifies gaps and asks clarifying questions

items.title: Automatic Breakdown
items.text: Complex features split into implementable tasks

items.title: Sprint Planning
items.text: AI-assisted estimation and prioritization

slides.title: Design & Architecture
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: AI assists in creating robust, scalable system designs.
slides.visualContent:
graph TD
    A[Requirements] --> B[AI Design Agent]
    B --> C[Architecture Options]
    C --> D[Trade-off Analysis]
    D --> E[Selected Design]
    E --> F[Component Specs]
    E --> G[API Contracts]
    E --> H[Data Models]

slides.title: Architecture Assistance
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: AI brings pattern knowledge and best practices to design decisions.

items.title: Pattern Recognition
items.text: Suggests appropriate architectural patterns for your use case

items.title: Trade-off Analysis
items.text: Evaluates scalability, maintainability, and cost implications

items.title: Diagram Generation
items.text: Creates visual representations of proposed architectures

items.title: ADR Generation
items.text: Generates Architecture Decision Records automatically

slides.title: Development & Coding
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: The most transformed phase of the SDLC.
slides.visualContent:
graph LR
    A[Task] --> B[Context Gathering]
    B --> C[Code Generation]
    C --> D[Self-Review]
    D --> E[Test Generation]
    E --> F[Iteration]
    F --> G[PR Ready]

slides.title: Agentic Coding Capabilities
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: What modern AI coding agents can do in 2025.

items.title: Full Feature Implementation
items.text: From task description to working code

items.title: Codebase Understanding
items.text: Navigates and comprehends entire repositories

items.title: Multi-file Orchestration
items.text: Coordinated edits across many files simultaneously

items.title: Autonomous Debugging
items.text: Diagnose, hypothesize, test, and fix issues

items.title: Legacy Modernization
items.text: Refactor and update legacy codebases

slides.title: The Agentic Loop
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: How agents iteratively solve complex problems with autonomy.
slides.visualContent:
graph TD
    A[Receive Task] --> B[Analyze Context]
    B --> C[Plan Approach]
    C --> D[Execute Step]
    D --> E{Success?}
    E -->|Yes| F[Next Step]
    E -->|No| G[Self-Correct]
    G --> C
    F --> H{Complete?}
    H -->|No| D
    H -->|Yes| I[Deliver Result]

slides.title: Testing & Quality
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: AI-powered testing with 50-70% fewer production defects.
slides.visualContent:
graph TD
    A[Code Change] --> B[AI Test Agent]
    B --> C[Unit Tests]
    B --> D[Integration Tests]
    B --> E[Edge Cases]
    C --> F[Coverage Analysis]
    D --> F
    E --> F
    F --> G[Quality Report]

slides.title: AI Testing Capabilities
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: Comprehensive quality assurance with AI assistance.

items.title: Test Generation
items.text: Automatic creation of unit and integration tests

items.title: Edge Case Discovery
items.text: AI identifies scenarios humans often miss

items.title: Regression Detection
items.text: Understands change impact across the system

items.title: AI Hallucination Catching
items.text: Dedicated tools catch AI-generated bugs before production

slides.title: Code Review Evolution
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: AI augments human review for faster, more thorough feedback.

items.title: Automated First Pass
items.text: AI catches common issues before human review

items.title: Security Scanning
items.text: Identifies OWASP vulnerabilities and suggests fixes

items.title: PR Analysis
items.text: Tools like CodeRabbit analyze PRs across IDEs and CLI

items.title: Real Bug Detection
items.text: Goes beyond linting to catch actual bugs

slides.title: Agentic DevOps
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: Microsoft's Build 2025 vision: AI agents across the DevOps lifecycle.
slides.visualContent:
graph LR
    A[Merge] --> B[AI CI/CD]
    B --> C[Build]
    C --> D[Test]
    D --> E[Deploy]
    E --> F[Monitor]
    F --> G[Alert]
    G --> H[Auto-Remediate]

slides.title: Intelligent Operations
slides.subtitle: The Phases
slides.content: AI-powered monitoring, deployment, and incident response.

items.title: Autonomous Bug Fixes
items.text: Copilot Agent Mode fixes bugs and reviews code

items.title: K8s Management
items.text: AI agents restart pods, scale deployments, summarize logs

items.title: Predictive Scaling
items.text: Capacity planning based on learned patterns

items.title: Auto-Remediation
items.text: Known issues fixed before humans are paged

slides.title: Model Context Protocol
slides.subtitle: The Tools
slides.content: The USB-C for AI: Standardizing agent-tool connections.
slides.visualContent:
graph TD
    subgraph MCP Client
        A[AI Agent]
    end
    subgraph MCP Servers
        B[Database]
        C[APIs]
        D[File System]
        E[Dev Tools]
    end
    A <-->|MCP| B
    A <-->|MCP| C
    A <-->|MCP| D
    A <-->|MCP| E

slides.title: MCP: The New Standard
slides.subtitle: The Tools
slides.content: Model Context Protocol is becoming the backbone of agentic workflows.

items.title: Universal Protocol
items.text: One integration unlocks entire ecosystem of tools

items.title: Major Adoption
items.text: Microsoft, OpenAI, Anthropic all supporting MCP

items.title: 75% by 2026
items.text: Gartner predicts API gateway vendors will have MCP features

items.title: Agent-to-Agent
items.text: A2A protocol enables multi-agent communication

slides.title: Modern Agentic Tools
slides.subtitle: The Tools
slides.content: The platforms powering agentic development in 2025.
slides.visualContent:
graph TD
    subgraph CLI Agents
        A[Claude Code]
        B[Gemini CLI]
        C[Aider]
    end
    subgraph IDE Agents
        D[Cursor]
        E[Windsurf]
        F[GitHub Copilot]
    end
    subgraph Autonomous
        G[Devin]
        H[Codex]
    end

slides.title: Claude Code
slides.subtitle: The Tools
slides.content: Anthropic's terminal-native agentic coding assistant.

items.title: Terminal-Native
items.text: Works where developers already are - in the CLI

items.title: Full Autonomy
items.text: Plan mode for complex tasks, autonomous execution

items.title: MCP Integration
items.text: Connect to any tool through Model Context Protocol

items.title: Security Review
items.text: Built-in /security-review command for vulnerability scanning

slides.title: Cursor & IDE Agents
slides.subtitle: The Tools
slides.content: AI-first IDEs with deep code understanding.

items.title: Cursor
items.text: AI-first IDE with Tab completions and Agent mode

items.title: Background Agents
items.text: Autonomous agents working in the cloud

items.title: Multi-Model
items.text: Switch between Claude, GPT, Gemini based on task

items.title: Windsurf
items.text: Agentic AI assistant with team collaboration

slides.title: Devin: The AI Engineer
slides.subtitle: The Tools
slides.content: Cognition's fully autonomous software engineer.

items.title: Full Autonomy
items.text: Plans, implements, and debugs from natural language

items.title: Cloud Environment
items.text: Complete development environment in the cloud

items.title: Async Workflows
items.text: Set tasks and get results, like a remote team member

items.title: End-to-End
items.text: From requirements to deployed application

slides.title: Security Risks
slides.subtitle: Security & Risks
slides.content: AI-generated code introduces new vulnerability patterns.
slides.visualContent:
graph TD
    A[AI Agent] --> B[Generated Code]
    B --> C{Security Scan}
    C -->|Vulnerabilities| D[10x More Findings]
    C -->|Clean| E[Safe to Deploy]
    D --> F[Human Review]
    F --> G[Remediation]

slides.title: The 10x Vulnerability Spike
slides.subtitle: Security & Risks
slides.content: AI coding assistants are shipping more risks at scale.

items.title: 10,000+ Findings/Month
items.text: AI-generated code introduced 10x more security findings by June 2025

items.title: All Categories
items.text: OSS dependencies, insecure patterns, secrets, misconfigs

items.title: Blind Trust
items.text: Developers often treat AI output as trustworthy without verification

items.title: Scale Problem
items.text: 4x velocity means 4x the attack surface if unchecked

slides.title: Agentic AI Security Threats
slides.subtitle: Security & Risks
slides.content: Unique risks introduced by autonomous AI agents.

items.title: Memory Poisoning
items.text: Attackers corrupt agent memory to alter behavior over time

items.title: Tool Misuse
items.text: Agents become vectors for lateral movement or RCE

items.title: Privilege Escalation
items.text: Manipulating agent identity flows to gain access

items.title: Prompt Injection
items.text: Malicious inputs that hijack agent behavior

slides.title: Security Best Practices
slides.subtitle: Security & Risks
slides.content: Mitigating risks while maintaining velocity.

items.title: Mandatory Review
items.text: All agent-generated code through human review before merge

items.title: Security Scanning
items.text: SAST/DAST tools trained on AI-specific vulnerability patterns

items.title: Least Privilege
items.text: Agents get minimum permissions needed for tasks

items.title: Provenance Tracking
items.text: Track which code was AI-generated for audit

items.title: Red Teaming
items.text: Adversarial testing of agentic workflows

slides.title: Best Practices
slides.subtitle: The Practice
slides.content: How to get the most from agentic development.
slides.visualContent:
graph TD
    A[Clear Intent] --> B[Good Context]
    B --> C[Iterative Refinement]
    C --> D[Human Oversight]
    D --> E[Continuous Learning]

slides.title: Working with AI Agents
slides.subtitle: The Practice
slides.content: Patterns for effective human-AI collaboration.

items.title: Plan First
items.text: Ask for a plan before implementation, review approach

items.title: Provide Context
items.text: Share relevant background, constraints, and examples

items.title: Interrupt & Redirect
items.text: Guide the agent when it goes off track

items.title: Verify Everything
items.text: Always review AI-generated code before shipping

items.title: Learn the Why
items.text: Understand what the AI did and why

slides.title: What to Delegate
slides.subtitle: The Practice
slides.content: Tasks where AI agents excel.

items.title: Boilerplate & Scaffolding
items.text: Repetitive patterns and project setup

items.title: Test Generation
items.text: Coverage expansion, edge cases, regression tests

items.title: Refactoring
items.text: Systematic improvements across codebase

items.title: Documentation
items.text: API docs, comments, READMEs, ADRs

items.title: Debugging
items.text: Root cause analysis with full codebase context

slides.title: What to Keep Human
slides.subtitle: The Practice
slides.content: Areas where human judgment remains essential.

items.title: Architecture Decisions
items.text: High-level design choices with long-term impact

items.title: Security-Critical Code
items.text: Auth, encryption, access control need expert review

items.title: Business Logic
items.text: Core domain rules and competitive differentiators

items.title: Ethical Decisions
items.text: Bias, fairness, and societal impact considerations

slides.title: Adoption Roadmap
slides.subtitle: The Practice
slides.content: A phased approach to agentic SDLC transformation.

items.title: Phase 1: Foundation (0-6 mo)
items.text: Adopt AI assistants, train teams, establish governance

items.title: Phase 2: Platform (6-18 mo)
items.text: Build Internal Developer Platform, integrate toolchain

items.title: Phase 3: Agentic (18+ mo)
items.text: Experiment with autonomous workflows, measure business value

slides.title: The Future
slides.subtitle: The Future
slides.content: Where agentic SDLC is heading.
slides.visualContent:
graph LR
    A[2025] --> B[2026]
    B --> C[2028+]
    A --- D[AI-Assisted 76%]
    B --- E[Agentic Mainstream]
    C --- F[AI Orchestrates Teams]

slides.title: Near-Term: 2025-2026
slides.subtitle: The Future
slides.content: What to expect in the next 12-18 months.

items.title: 60-80% Automation
items.text: AI will handle majority of repetitive coding tasks

items.title: AI-Managed Projects
items.text: Common for smaller, well-defined applications

items.title: Testing Revolution
items.text: AI testing will outperform traditional QC in speed and accuracy

items.title: Autonomous DevOps
items.text: AI handling deployments and monitoring goes mainstream

slides.title: Emerging Capabilities
slides.subtitle: The Future
slides.content: The next wave of agentic development.

items.title: Multi-Agent Systems
items.text: Specialized agents collaborating via A2A protocol

items.title: AI Agent Factories
items.text: Entire SDLC from requirements to deployment by agents

items.title: Proactive Assistance
items.text: AI that anticipates needs before you ask

items.title: Self-Improving Codebases
items.text: Continuous automated optimization and modernization

slides.title: Preparing Your Team
slides.subtitle: The Future
slides.content: How to position yourself and your organization for success.

items.title: Embrace the Tools
items.text: Start using AI assistants in your daily workflow today

items.title: Elevate Your Role
items.text: Shift from coder to intent-setter and reviewer

items.title: Focus on Architecture
items.text: High-level design becomes more valuable than typing

items.title: Learn Agent Engineering
items.text: Building and orchestrating agents is the new skill

slides.title: Key Takeaways
slides.subtitle: Summary
slides.content: The essential points to remember.

items.title: AI Elevates, Not Replaces
items.text: Developers become intent-setters, reviewers, and strategists

items.title: Security is Critical
items.text: 10x velocity without safeguards means 10x vulnerabilities

items.title: MCP is the Standard
items.text: Model Context Protocol unifies agent-tool connections

items.title: Start Today
items.text: 76% of the industry is already moving - don't get left behind

slides.title: Thank You
slides.subtitle: Agentic SDLC
slides.content: Questions? Let's discuss the future of software development.
slides.visualContent:
graph TD
    A[You] --> B[AI Agent]
    B --> C[Better Software]
    C --> D[Faster]
    C --> E[Higher Quality]
